paper_title: Uniform distribution of $αn$ modulo one for a family of integer sequences
abstract: We show that the sequence $(αn)_{n\in \mathcal{B}}$ is uniformly distributed modulo 1, for every irrational $α$, provided $\mathcal{B}$ belongs to a certain family of integer sequences, which includes the prime, almost prime, squarefree, practical, densely divisible and lexicographical numbers. We also give an estimate for the discrepancy if $α$ has finite irrationality measure.
